title: Bone health
story: Ruth is a 50-year-old woman who consumes dairy and other food with calcium and vitamin D, but is not physically active. Older women lose bone mass more quickly than younger women, making it easier to break bones, and without physical activity, a person's body doesn't use calcium and vitamin D to replenish bone mass as effectively. Thus, when Ruth had minor fall one day, she hurt her wrist badly. When Ruth visited a doctor to check her injury, the doctor asked about her daily routines, and ordered an X-ray. The doctor found a fracture, and also diagnosed Ruth with osteoporosis, which is a loss of bone density. The doctor explained the diagnosis, and told Ruth that a healthy diet and physical activity are both needed to maintain healthy bones. The doctor suggested walking more and doing weight-bearing exercises. Ruth began walking each day to and from the store, and began exercising regularly with light weights. This reduced the rate at which her bones were losing mass, helping her to avoid more serious fractures in the future.

story: Ruth is a 50-year-old woman who consumes dairy and other food with calcium and vitamin D, but is not physically active. When Ruth had minor fall one day, she hurt her wrist badly. When Ruth visited a doctor to check her injury, the doctor asked about her daily routines. The doctor ordered an X-ray. and found a fracture. The doctor diagnosed Ruth with osteoporosis, which is a loss of bone density, and explained the diagnosis. The doctor told Ruth that a healthy diet and physical activity are both needed to maintain healthy bones. The doctor suggested walking more and doing weight-bearing exercises. Older women lose bone mass more quickly than younger women, making it easier to break bones, and without physical activity, a person's body doesn't use calcium and vitamin D to replenish bone mass as effectively. Ruth began walking each day to and from the store, and began exercising regularly with light weights. This reduced the rate at which her bones were losing mass, helping her to avoid more serious fractures in the future.

survey: eat more lean meats or beans
title: Parenting health
story: When Jason became a new parent, he and his partner felt very stressed and tired. Because they had little time, they ate lots of fast-food (like pizza and burgers). Fast food is usually high in calories and saturated fat and low in nutrients. This kind of diet can cause people to feel sluggish and irritable. Thus Jason and his partner became even more stressed and bickered a lot. The couple decided to go to couples counseling. The counselor asked about their eating schedule, and told them that their diet could be making things harder. The counselor suggested that the couple plan their meals ahead of time, and suggested eating lean meats and beans. The couple took the counselor's advice, started planning their meals every week, and made food at home with lean meats and beans. This helped with their energy levels and moods, and they bickered less.

title: Skin health
story: Jonathan is a young man who has a demanding job. He experiences a lot of stress, which makes it hard for him to sleep at night. So, Jonathan drinks a lot of coffee to stay awake, and rarely drinks water. Stress can have detrimental effects on skin, like acne or worsening eczema, and being dehydrated also has negative consequences for skin tone. One day Jonathan noticed his skin was starting to look unhealthy. Jonathan went to a dermatologist. The dermatologist asked about his stress levels and water consumption. his dermatologist suggested that Jonathan start practicing meditation and that he drink more water throughout the day. Jonathan took his dermatologist's advice. He took an online meditation course, and started drinking more water throughout the day. This reduced his stress levels, and so he started sleeping better. Along with increased hydration, this also made his skin healthier.

distractor.probe: The Colorado River is the principal river of the Southwestern United States and northwest Mexico.  Known for its dramatic scenery and its whitewater, the Colorado carves numerous gorges, including the Grand Canyon in northern Arizona. For 8,000 years, the Colorado Basin was only sparsely populated by Native Americans, though some of their ancient civilizations employed advanced irrigation techniques. Even after becoming part of theU.S. in the 1800s, the Colorado River country remained extremely remote until John Wesley Powell's 1869 river-running expedition, which began to open up the river for future development. Since the completion of Hoover Dam in 1935, the Colorado has been tamed by an extensive system of dams and canals, providing for irrigation, cities, and hydropower. Today the Colorado supports 40 million people in seven U.S. and two Mexican states; with every drop of its water allocated, it no longer reaches the sea except in years of heavy runoff.
distractor.question: Based on the passage above, which of the following are associated with the Colorado River?
